title: How long is a football match?
content: A football match lasts 90 minutes, split into two halves, with a halftime break and potential added time.

title: Most goals in a Premier League season
content: Erling Haaland scored 36 goals in 2022/23 — the most in a single PL season.

title: Fastest Premier League player
content: Kyle Walker clocked 37.31 km/h — the league's top sprint speed.

title: Kids football boots
content: Top choices for youth players include Adidas X Crazyfast, Nike Jr. Vapor, and Puma Ultra Play.

title: List of Premier League winners
content: All champions since 1992, from Manchester United to Manchester City in recent years.

title: Longest unbeaten run in football
content: AC Milan holds the domestic league record with 58 matches unbeaten.

title: Most expensive football transfer
content: Neymar transferred to PSG in 2017 for €222 million — still the highest.

title: Most red cards in football
content: Gerardo Bedoya holds the record with 46 red cards in his career.

title: Oldest football player
content: Kazuyoshi Miura is still playing professionally at over 57 years old.

title: Premier League referee salaries
content: Referees earn up to £1,500 per match and annual retainers of around £42,000.

title: Smallest Premier League stadium
content: Kenilworth Road (Luton Town) is the smallest, with around 11,500 seats.

title: Top 10 Premier League goal scorers
content: Alan Shearer leads with 260 goals, followed by Kane and Rooney.

title: What do goalkeepers wear?
content: Goalkeepers wear gloves, padded kits, and often extra protection for dives and collisions.

title: What does FT mean in football?
content: FT stands for Full Time, signaling the end of a match in scores or coverage.

title: What does offside mean?
content: A player is offside if they’re closer to the goal than both the ball and second-last defender when played in.

title: What is a brace in football?
content: A brace is when a player scores two goals in a single match.

title: What is a clean sheet in football?
content: A clean sheet means a team finishes a match without conceding a single goal.

title: What is a false 9 in football?
content: A false 9 is a striker who drops deep into midfield to disrupt defenders and link play — famously used by Messi.

title: What is a hat-trick in football?
content: When a player scores three goals in a single match — a celebrated milestone.

title: What is goal difference in football?
content: It’s the difference between goals scored and goals conceded — used to separate teams level on points.

title: What is stoppage time in football?
content: Time added by the referee to account for delays — typically a few minutes at the end of each half.

title: What is VAR in football?
content: VAR (Video Assistant Referee) helps review goals, penalties, red cards, and mistaken identity decisions.

title: Who invented football?
content: The modern game began in England with the rules formalized in 1863 by The Football Association.

title: Why do footballers tape their socks?
content: To secure shin pads, connect grip socks to standard socks, and improve comfort or support.

title: Why do players get yellow cards?
content: For fouls, unsporting behavior, delaying restarts, dissent, or breaking substitution rules.

title: Worst Premier League team
content: Derby County holds the record for fewest points in a season — just 11 points in 2007/08.

title: Youngest Premier League player
content: Ethan Nwaneri debuted for Arsenal at just 15 years and 181 days old.

title: Do football pools still exist?
content: Yes — you can still play traditional football pools today via sites like ThePools.com, with weekly prize draws.

title: Grip socks in football
content: Grip socks improve traction inside boots, reduce blisters, and enhance stability when turning or sprinting.

title: Football quiz questions
content: Test your knowledge with our top 10 football trivia questions — ideal for fans of all levels.

title: Football museum
content: The National Football Museum in Manchester is the UK's top destination for historic kits, trophies & memorabilia.

title: Can goalkeepers score goals?
content: Yes! Some goalkeepers have scored from penalties, free-kicks, and even clearances. Some have 100+ career goals.
